isis.stitle: DT/DTI-466 A and B Series DT/DTI/DTA-466 C Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1993) - ENGINE DIAGNOSTIC TEST PROCEDURES - DT/DTI - 466 A AND B SERIES DIESEL ENGINES - SHUT-OFF CABLE DT/DTI-466 A and B Series (With UTDS Model 100 Fuel Injection Pump) - Reassembly

step1.para:
Assemble gaskets (9, Figures 5.7 and 5.9)
and bracket (13) to rod guide screw (10) and install to control unit cover (1) when clamped in vise. Tighten rod guide screw (10) to 33 lbf-ft. (45 N.m).

Slide Bowden Wire Rod (11, Figures 5.7 and 5.9)
into rod guide screw (10) and control unit cover (1).

Install "O" ring (8, Figures 5.7 and 5.9)
and spring guide (7) onto rod (11).

Wire back Bowden Wire Rod (11, Figures 5.7 and 5.9
) so assembly remains in shut-off position. Insert the upper spring (6) with upper spring guide (5) onto rod (11).

Insert control unit lever (4, Figures 5.7 and 5.9) onto rod (11),
then install and compress lower spring (3) using a suitable spring compressor tool. Insert the lower spring guide (2) over the shoulder of the Bowden Wire Rod (11) using a suitable expander tool.
Release from shut-off position, remove from vise and install control unit cover with Bowden Wire Shut-Off to the pump.
Tighten control unit screws to 25-30 lbf-in. (2-3 N.m).

The Bowden Wire Cable must be positioned to pull in a straight line. If the cable pulls to the side, the side force may damage the Bowden Wire Rod. Adjust to allow full run position, refer to the appropriate chassis manual.

Assemble gaskets (7, Figures 5.8 and 5.10)
and bracket (12 or 13) to rod guide screw (8) and install to control unit cover (1) when clamped in vise. Tighten rod guide screw (8) to 33 lbf-ft. (45N.m).

Slide Bowden Wire Rod (10, Figures 5.8 and 5.10)
into rod guide screw (8) and control unit cover (1).

Install "O" ring (9, Figures 5.8 and 5.10)
on to rod (10).

Wire back Bowden Wire Rod (10, Figures 5.8 and 5.10)
so assembly remains in shut-off position. Insert the upper spring (6) with upper spring guide (5) onto rod (10).

Insert control unit lever (4, Figures 5.8 and 5.10)
onto rod (10), then install and compress lower spring (3) using a suitable spring compressor tool. Insert the lower spring guide (2) over the shoulder of the Bowden Wire Rod (10) using a suitable expander tool.
Release from shut-off position, remove from vise and install control unit cover with Bowden Wire Shut-Off to the pump.
Tighten control unit screws to 25-30 lbf-in. (2-3 N.m).

The Bowden Wire Cable must be positioned to pull in a straight line. If the cable pulls to the side, the side force may damage the Bowden Wire Rod. Adjust to allow full run position, refer to the appropriate chassis manual.
